Web Hosting Made Simple

We're Fast

The average user will close a webpage in less than 3 seconds if it hasn't loaded. People want their content and they want it fast. All of our servers use solid state drives, the fastest of their kind, and built on top of Hex Core machines. Because you deserve it.

We're Always Up

Our servers are always up and delivering content any time of the day and year with a 99.99% uptime guarantee. If we ever fail to deliver, we will credit you 2x the amount of server time lost. No need to even ask!

We're Simple

Whether this is your first or 100th time setting up a server you'll have no problem getting started. We offer servers that come preconfigured with popular content management systems such as Wordpress, Drupal, and Joomla. If you're just looking for a basic server, we offer you several options of Linux-based servers with LAMP and LEMP stacks.

We're Always There

Our servers are always up and running, so we think our support should be too! We offer 24/7 support over phone, email, and chat with any hosting plan â€” no matter the size.

So what do you say?

About

SpeedyMama is a ficticious company and was created as a portfolio piece by Tanner Woodworth.

Who is SpeedyMama?

SpeedyMama is a web hosting company that was formed with one goal in mind, to make setting up a server as easy as possible. We first started in 2007 as a local business based in Madison, Wisconsin hosting websites for other local companies. As it turns out, people have a thing for fast and inexpnsive hosting. We now have servers in over 30 locations in the United States, including New York City, Palo Alto, Glendale, Miami, and Olympia

Who uses SpeedyMama?

Many companies trust SpeedyMama to deliver their content, including Facetook, Fashable, New York Mimes, BluePaper Media, and Manatee Fair Magazine.

How do we Stack?

Why does transfer speed matter?

Transfer speeds affect how fast your page loads. Slower transfer speeds mean slower delivery.

How Does Pricing Work?

We honestly belive you should should only pay for what you use. So, we only charge you for what you use! Let's say you set up a server on the first of the month and you only use it for 15 days. You are only charged for that 15 days rather than the full month.
